page.title: 17LOCAL HISTORY(CONT)
page.content:
{ NEOLITHIC CAVE (CONT.FROM P.16)}
{ }On the wall there is an outcrop of rock which resembles a fish.You can see where the Neolithic man with his primitive tools has drilled a hole in the rock for the fishes eye and has shaped the tail a little bit more. On the back wall of the cave there is what we think is a primitive calendar,being a series of engraved lines. Where the cave ends it decreases into a small, narrow impenetrable tunnel. Outside there is a circle of stones rather like a miniature Stone Henge where the Neolithic man would worship. {BY { GWEN { McCROSSAN
